title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7.20 - Executive Order No. 20: Naming the State Justice Building the Robert Abrams Building for Law and Justice
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7.20 - Executive Order No. 20: Naming the State Justice Building the Robert Abrams Building for Law and Justice

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the principles of law and justice represent the
cornerstone of our society, and are essential to maintaining order, protecting
the rights of persons and preserving our way of life; and
WHEREAS, Robert Abrams' illustrious twenty eight year
career in public service was dedicated to the rule of law and the pursuit of
justice, and was marked by achievement, independence and integrity; and
WHEREAS, Robert Abrams was elected to three terms in the

New York State Assembly, three terms as the Bronx Borough President, and four
terms as the New York State Attorney General and served with honor and
distinction in each of these posts; and
WHEREAS, as New York State Attorney General, Robert Abrams
fought fiercely for the people of this State, protecting consumer and civil
rights and launching ground-breaking efforts in the areas of environmental
protection and criminal prosecution; and
WHEREAS, through his many accomplishments as New York State

Attorney General, Robert Abrams serves as a national model for state attorneys
general throughout the nation; and
WHEREAS, Robert Abrams' career in public service has left
an indelible mark on the history of this State, demonstrating his unwavering
commitment to the people and his unflinching dedication to the law and the
pursuit of justice; NOW, THEREFORE, I, David A. Paterson, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby proclaim and direct that the State

Justice Building, located in the Empire State Plaza, in the City of Albany, County of Albany, shall hereafter be known as the Robert Abrams Building for

Law and Justice. Signed: David A. Paterson

Dated: May 29, 2009

Notes

7.20

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
